content:
I don't have personal preferences, but i can suggest some songs by the ravens that are considered classics and are a good place to start:

1. "count every star" - this is the ravens' most well-known song and a great example of their signature harmonizing vocals.

2. "ol' man river" - this song is a cover of the classic show tune, but the ravens put their own spin on it with their powerful vocals and bluesy interpretation.

3. "deep purple" - another classic ravens song that showcases their harmonizing vocals and romantic lyrics.

4. "write me a letter" - this upbeat track features a swing-influenced rhythm, catchy hooks, and strong vocal performances.

5. "a simple prayer" - a lesser-known ravens song that showcases their gospel roots and powerful vocal harmonies.

these songs are just a few examples of the many great tracks that the ravens recorded during their career. they are a good starting point for anyone who is new to their music and wants to discover what makes them such an important group in the history of r&b and doo-wop.
